\section{Generation of Columbia University COMS3251: Computational Linear Algebra}
\label{sec:generation-COMS3251}

\begin{longtable}{|l|p{8cm}|p{8cm}|}
\caption{New questions generated from COMS3251 Computational Linear Algebra questions, and the closest question among the existing questions.}\\
\hline
\textbf{ID} & \textbf{Auto-Generated question} & \textbf{Closest question in the dataset}\\
\hline
1 & Find the eigenvalues of the matrix $A   \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ -2 & -3 \end{bmatrix}$
& 
Find the eigenvalues of 
$\begin{bmatrix}
-0.2&0.3\\
0.2&-0.3
\end{bmatrix}$
\\
\hline
2 & Find the rank of the following matrix: $\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 4 & 5 & 6 \\ 7 & 8 & 9 \end{bmatrix}$ & Find the nullity of the following matrix:
$\begin{bmatrix}
3&-2&-1&0&2\\
1&-2&1&-2&4\\
-4&4&0&2&-6
\end{bmatrix}$
\\
\hline
3 & 
Compute the determinant of the following matrix: $\begin{bmatrix} 1 & -2 \\ -2 & -4 \end{bmatrix}$ & Compute the determinant of the following matrix:
$\begin{bmatrix}
3&-4&5 \\
0&-1&-5\\
5&-4&3
\end{bmatrix}$\\
\hline
4 & 
Find the determinant of the following matrix: $\begin{bmatrix} 1 & -2 & -1 \\ 0 & 2 & -3 \\ -4 & -5 & 6\end{bmatrix}$ & 
Compute the determinant of the following matrix:
$\begin{bmatrix}
3&-4&5 \\
0&-1&-5\\
5&-4&3
\end{bmatrix}$
\\ 
\hline
5 & 
Compute an LU decomposition of the matrix $A   \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ -2 & -3 \end{bmatrix}$ &
Find an LU decomposition of the following matrix:
$\begin{bmatrix}
-1&-1&2 \\
2&0&3\\
-3&2&1
\end{bmatrix}$
\\
\hline
6 &
Which of the following matrices is a left inverse to $A\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 & -3 \\ -1 & -1 & 0 \\ -2 & -3 & 3 \end{bmatrix}?$ \newline
(a) $\begin{bmatrix} -1 & 0 & 2 \\ -2 & -3 & 3 \\ -6 & -9 & 9 \end{bmatrix}$ \newline
(b) $\begin{bmatrix} -1 & -1 & 0 \\ \frac{1}{2} & -\frac{1}{2} & 0\\ \frac{1}{6} & -\frac{2}{6} & \frac{3}{6} \end{bmatrix}$ \newline
(c) $\begin{bmatrix} -1 & -2 & -3 \\ \frac{1}{2} & -\frac{1}{2} & 0\\ \frac{1}{6} & -\frac{4}{6} & \frac{9}{6} \end{bmatrix}$ \newline
(d) None of the above. & 
Compute the inverse of the following matrix:
$\begin{bmatrix}
-1&-2 \\
-2&0
\end{bmatrix}$
\\
\hline
7 &
Find a combination of the vectors $\begin{bmatrix} 1 \\ 2 \\ 3 \end{bmatrix}$, $\begin{bmatrix} 4 \\ 5 \\ 6 \end{bmatrix}$, and $\begin{bmatrix} 7 \\ 8 \\ 9 \end{bmatrix}$ that gives the vector $$\begin{bmatrix} 12 \\ 23 \end{bmatrix}$$ & 
Find a combination of the vectors 
$\begin{bmatrix}
1 \\
2\\
3
\end{bmatrix}$,
$\begin{bmatrix}
4\\
5\\
6
\end{bmatrix}$, and 
$\begin{bmatrix}
7\\
8\\
9
\end{bmatrix}$ that give the zero vector.
\\
\hline
8 &
What is the dimension of the subspace spanned by the following vectors?
$\begin{bmatrix} 1 \\ 2 \\ 3 \end{bmatrix},\begin{bmatrix} 0 \\ 1 \\ 0 \end{bmatrix}, \begin{bmatrix} -\frac{1}{2} \\ -\frac{1}{3} \\ 1 \end{bmatrix}$ &
What is the dimension of the subspace spanned by the following vectors?$\begin{bmatrix} 2 \\ -\frac{1}{2} \end{bmatrix}, \begin{bmatrix} 1 \\ 1 \end{bmatrix}, \begin{bmatrix} 4 \\ 4 \end{bmatrix}$
\\
\hline
9 & 
Find the projection matrix onto the column space of $A   \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 4 & 5 & 6 \end{bmatrix}$ & 
Find the projection matrix onto the column space of A $\begin{bmatrix} 3 & 6 & 6 \\ 4 & 8 & 8 \end{bmatrix}$.
\\
\hline
10 & Find a combination of the vectors $\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 4 & 5 & 6 \\ 7 & 8 & 9 \end{bmatrix}$ that gives the vector $\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \end{bmatrix}$. & Find a combination of the vectors $\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 4 & 5 & 6 \\ 7 & 8 & 9 \end{bmatrix}$ that give the zero vector.
\\
\hline
\end{longtable}
title: A Neural Network Solves, Explains, and Generates University Math Problems by Program Synthesis and Few-Shot Learning at Human Level
